Description: Doll; bone; with incised facial features; pierced shoulders through which is threaded a piece of string attaching two arms; the neck, chest and midriff are defined by grooved lines.
Curator's comments: On dolls of this type: A. Shatil, "Bone Figurines of the Early Islamic Period: The So Called 'Coptic Dolls' from Palestine and Egypt", in: S. Vitezović, ed. Close to the Bone: Current Studies in Bone Technologies (Belgrade 2016) 296-314.
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
